content.question: A box is pushed across a surface where friction between the box and the surface is negligible. There is a resistive force from the air exerted on the box equal to <math alttext="F sub R equals negative k v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>R</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>v</mi></mstyle></math>. Which of the following graphs correctly models the relationship between the power <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>P</mi></math> required to move the box at a constant speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math>, as a function of the speed of the box?

choices.label: The figure shows a graph of a curve in a 6 by 5 gridded plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “v, in meters per second.” The vertical axis is labeled “Power, in watts.” The curve begins at the origin and moves upward and to the right, gradually at first and then more steeply, and ends at coordinates 6 comma 5.

The figure shows a graph of a line in a 6 by 5 gridded plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “v, in meters per second.” The vertical axis is labeled “Power, in watts.” The line begins at the origin and moves upward and to the right steadily and ends at coordinates 6 comma 5.

The figure shows a graph of a line in a 6 by 5 gridded plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “v, in meters per second.” The vertical axis is labeled “Power, in watts.” The line begins at coordinates 0 comma 3 and moves horizontally to the right and ends at coordinates 6 comma 3.

The figure shows a graph of a line in a 6 by 5 gridded plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “v, in meters per second.” The vertical axis is labeled “Power, in watts.” The curve begins at coordinates 0 comma 5 and moves downward and to the right, steeply at first and then more gradually, and ends at coordinates 6 comma 0.

content.answer: The figure shows a graph of a curve in a 6 by 5 gridded plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “v, in meters per second.” The vertical axis is labeled “Power, in watts.” The curve begins at the origin and moves upward and to the right, gradually at first and then more steeply, and ends at coordinates 6 comma 5.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
